Assay of 5-lipoxygenase. Lipoxygenase assay was performed by mixing equal quantities of linoleic acid (70 mg) and tween 20 in 4 mL of nonoxygenated water. To this mixture, sodium hydroxide (0.5 N) was added, and nonoxygenated water is added in a quantity sufficient to make a volume up to 25 mL. The resulting solution will be divided into 0.5 mL portions and thoroughly rinsed with nitrogen and then left for freezing. A quartz cuvette (25°C) with 1 cm optical pathway made it possible to carry out a reaction. The optic density (OD) was measured at 234 nm with a mixture containing sodium linoleate (0.2 mL), Tris buffer (2.75 mL, pH 7.4), and enzyme (50 mL) [ 23].
